definition: to carp/nitpicking/petty criticism
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
(onom.) whoosh
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: Why is it that the BBC always nitpicks at China's achievements in space.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼BBC總是對中國在太空取得的成就挑刺？

sentences.english: If you look for things your partner does wrong, you can always find something.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想挑刺，你總是能找到你的伴侶犯的錯誤。

sentences.english: Corporate jets are easy to pick on.
sentences.chinese: 在公司專機問題上挑刺很容易。

definition: to look for bones in an egg/to find fault/to nitpick (idiom)
pinyin: ji1 dan4 li5 tiao1 gu3 tou5

definition: to nitpick/petty criticism/to nag
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to pick on sth incessantly (idiom)/to criticize right and left
pinyin: heng2 tiao1 bi2 zi5 shu4 tiao1 yan3

definition: to criticize
a thorn/fig. to ridicule sb/fig. sth wrong
to be picky/to be choosy
to pick a quarrel/to find fault/nitpicking
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
unpleasant to the eye/objectionable
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
